intro: Varronia anisodonta, commonly known as the African soursop or African star-apple, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The tree produces a large, spiny fruit that resembles a star-apple, with a thick, green rind and a sweet, juicy pulp. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts across its native range.
